summary: This appears to be a medical record or prescription form for Jeffrey Epstein from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, dated July 30, 2019. It documents a prescription for methylprednisolone tablets and includes a confiscation note from October 12, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The document is a medical record/prescription form for Jeffrey Epstein while he was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

events.title: Epstein Prescription Issued
events.description: A prescription for methylprednisolone 4mg tablets (21 count) was issued to Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

events.title: Medication Confiscation
events.description: The document includes a note indicating "Confiscate" with the date 10/12/19, suggesting medication was seized or removed from Epstein's possession.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was prescribed methylprednisolone (a steroid medication) on July 30, 2019, while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
The prescription was for a 21-count pack of 4mg tablets with refills authorized until August 5, 2019.
A handwritten note on the document indicates "Confiscate" with the date 10/12/19 (October 12, 2019), suggesting medication was seized from Epstein.
The document references both the New York correctional facility and Peapack, NJ, which was Epstein's primary residence.
This medical record dates from approximately two weeks before Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
